intro: Disa inflexa, commonly known as the orchid orchid, is a striking member of the Orchidaceae family native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically blooms during the summer months, producing clusters of tubular or hooded flowers. Disa inflexa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and forest margins. Its unique floral structure and ornamental value make it a popular choice for botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
